top_comment.text:
Everyone is attacking Dahee, but are people really going to ignore the fact 
that Lee Byung Hun was cheating on his wife. ﻿
top_comment.author: InTheMourning421

comments.text:
+Ian Cheng Cheating is horrible, probably is but I don't feel liek the law 
should do anything with it. I'm agaisnt marrige a lot and I feel like the 
people that get married should take care of it themselves. 
If someone get shot or anything like that of course the law take care of 
it, but cheating? That's on the partners shoulders. 

I know that. I think it's right to blame both of them but only one person 
actually broke the law. I'm just one of those people that is in the middle 
not caring at all really. She is in prison and he's not....
comments.author: Cheol Jay

comments.text:
+Cheol Jay Personally I feel there should be some repercussions for 
cheating, I don't know what but there should be something. When (most) 
people get married they're putting a lot of trust in the other person. When 
they break that trust, they basically stomp all over the other person. 
There's emotional trauma, families get torn apart, someone could get shot, 
worst case scenario.

There's just people on both sides who are really strongly opinionated. She 
went to jail? He caused it! or Serves her right! That slut!, etc. etc. I'm 
generalizing here, but you get the picture

Hope that wasn't too long winded
comments.author: Ian Cheng

comments.text:
+Ian Cheng That's true. He got off easy but what could people really do? 
I'm not defending him at all but I just think it's ridiculous that people 
are saying that he should be in prison. You don't go into prison for 
cheating. .
comments.author: Cheol Jay

comments.text:
+Cheol Jay I doubt he received much punishment from his wife. There's a 
double standard here.

Not trying to defend her, but he got off really light, and it sets a bad 
example for a lot of other guys out there.
comments.author: Ian Cheng

comments.text:
+maniachik92 Looks like many people looked at it very seriously. I have 
never really heard about anyone gone into prison for cheating. If it wasn't 
with a minor that is
comments.author: Cheol Jay

comments.text:

comments.author: maniachik92

comments.text:
+Ian Cheng He probably got punished by his wife, wouldn't suprise me. Still 
saying that she didn't do anything wrong and that people shouldn't blame 
her is still crazy, people should just accept that she did wrong.
comments.author: Cheol Jay

comments.text:
Blackmailing is against the law, true, what she did was wrong, and should 
be punished. And even though there appears to be no law regarding adultery, 
cheating on your spouse, is still wrong. It may not be punishable in court, 
but the fact that he faced virtually no repurcussions is what irritates me. 
Byung Hun and Dahee both made terrible mistakes, but only punishing one of 
them doesn't seem just
comments.author: Ian Cheng

comments.text:
Dahee did it for the money. I personally think it's showbiz that's at 
fault. Glam is not a big group therefore their wage is probably very small 
and thus Dahee was struggling to pay her debts to the company. She had 
explained that she did it to pay off for her trainee debts.she still owed 
the company around 285k USD. I'm not saying she's not in the wrong (please 
she split up her band) because she most definitely is. However, I dont 
think it's that nice to be telling her to "enjoy" her "time in prison" just 
because she wanted to pay off her debts. (debts suck b y e)

top_comment.text:
Dahee is such a greedy, stupid bitch at such young age. She is a criminal 
and we are talking about 5 fucking million $ here. They should have known 
better 5 million $ can't easily be erased from someone's fortune without 
getting caught by taxmen, government would be all over your ass and they 
probably asked for cash which is another pain in the ass. If they demanded 
a lesser amount they could have gotten away, their greed caught up to them.

Second dire mistake of them was not considering Lee Byung Hun is a shady 
person with dark past with wealth and influence and he is definitely not a 
decent person. He'll most likely come for blood whether fucking with Dahee 
and other girl or with their families in every possible way.﻿

comments.text:
+TheSaturdaysUKTeamSats! It's possible that the other members decided 
splitting up was the best idea. GLAM really needed to be promoted more 
though, they had a lot of potential. I love Bangtan, but BigHit did kind of 
just drop GLAM and promote the hell out of Bangtan. I mean it could be 
possible that BigHit (seeing as it's not a huge company) is falling under 
money issues and that's why they've been forcing Bangtan to promote so 
much. (After all I'm pretty sure Bangtan is their only really popular 
group. Homme isn't that well known and 2am isn't under their label anymore.)
GLAM didn't get that popular despite debuting in 2012, where as Bangtan has 
just been getting more and more famous. I think BigHit is relying on 
Bangtan to keep the company from going under.
comments.author: NinjaKittkatt
